title: Chicken Pot Pie (Betty Crocker Cook Book)
directions: Heat margarine over low heat until melted. Blend in flour, onion, salt, and pepper. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until mixture is smootha d bubbly. Remove from heat. Stir in broth and milk. Heat to boiling, stirring constantly. Boil and stir 1 minute. Stir in chicken and frozen vegetables.

Pour chicken mixture into a 9 x 9 x 2 pan (or something similar). Place pie crust on top of mixture. Cut a slit in the center to allow steam to escape. Cook uncovered in 425 degree oven until crust is brown - 30 to 35 minutes.
ingredients: A home made chicken pot pie is so much better than a purchase one. I can never have enough around for the family. THis recipe uses unsalted butter and a very low sodium chicken broth from our local grocery store.
2 cups cut up cooked chicken (@ 1 pound of chicken)
1 package (10 oz) frozen peas and carrots

Heat margarine over low heat until melted. Blend in flour, onion, salt, and pepper. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until mixture is smootha d bubbly. Remove from heat. Stir in broth and milk. Heat to boiling, stirring constantly. Boil and stir 1 minute. Stir in chicken and frozen vegetables.

Pour chicken mixture into a 9 x 9 x 2 pan (or something similar). Place pie crust on top of mixture. Cut a slit in the center to allow steam to escape. Cook uncovered in 425 degree oven until crust is brown - 30 to 35 minutes.
This make @ 6 servings (8 if you would like the calorie count a bit lower).
